visualization_prompt: Generate a boxplot chart showing whisker length variations across three data points using Highcharts series-level and point-specific configurations
visualization_explanation: This boxplot visualization encodes three synthetic distributions with identical quartile values (low=1, q1=2, median=3, q3=4, high=5) but distinct whisker configurations. The dataset contains three univariate observations with ordinal x-axis positioning. Synthetic data maintains constant interquartile ranges while demonstrating whisker length variations. The boxplot format was chosen for its efficiency in displaying distribution statistics per Tufte's data-ink principles. Cairo's perceptual effectiveness is achieved through position encoding for quartiles and length encoding for whiskers. Configuration parameters (μ=3, IQR=2 across all points) create controlled comparisons while whisker lengths (50%-150%) demonstrate visual customization capabilities.
